page.title: 11THOMAS A BECKET CHURCH CAPEL
page.content: CAPEL CHURCH WAS DEDICATED TO{THOMAS A {BECKET ARCHBISHOP OF CANTERBURY}WHO WAS MURDERED IN CANTERBURY CATHEDRAL IN THE REIGN OF HENRY II.TUDELEY CHURCH WAS LISTED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK BUT NOT CAPEL WHICH WAS BUILT AS A {CHAPEL FOR PILGRIMS BY THE KNIGHTS {HOSPITALER.}CAPEL HAS BEAUTIFUL 13TH CENTURY{WALL PAINTINGS}REVEALED IN 1927 AND PRESERVED. THEY SHOW SCENES FROM THE BIBLE SUCH AS THE LAST SUPPER AND CAIN SLAYING ABEL. A TINY NORMAN WINDOW SET DEEP ON THE NORTH WALL INDICATES THAT A CHAPEL WAS BUILT HERE IN NORMAN TIMES. THERE IS A TIMBERED ROOF WITH A{FINE KING POST.}ON JANUARY 15TH. 1639 DURING A VIOLENT STORM IN THIS PART OF KENT LIGHTNING STRUCK THE TOWER AND DESTROYED THE SOUTH WALL NOW REBUILT. THE PARISH{ROLL OF HONOUR ABOVE THE FONT BEARS THE WORDS{"WE {GAVE OUR TODAY FOR YOUR TOMORROW".
